location: San Francisco, California, United States Contact info
company: Editorial and Content Creation New York University
about: I am a San Francisco-based freelance writer and editor specializing in lifestyle content—style, design, travel, wellness, arts & culture, food & drink. I am the San Francisco editor for PureWow and regularly contribute to the San Francisco Chronicle, Sunset Magazine, Interiors California, Luxe Interiors Design, and California Home Design. I have also been published in Dwell, Ozy, Yoga Journal, Rodale’s Organic Life, Time Out SF, and Weddings CA. In addition to editorial work, I have written marketing content for companies such as Square, Visit California, and IfOnly and help businesses improve their online presence by developing SEO-friendly web copy, blog posts, and marketing collateral. google_info: self employed painter / artist - Bruce Richards Studio | LinkedIn
name: Bruce Richards
location: Dobbs Ferry, New York, United States Contact info
about: I am a painter interested art historical knowledge to allow the viewer to visualize and make their previous associations with objects into concepts for a visual dialogue. To reorient their past awareness with a new perspective to contemplate. In addition to painting my practice also includes, printmaking, watercolor, and sculpture in an effort to best display these ideas.. Perspective, color theory, composition and graduate seminars were some of the courses I taught over a 25 year period at various art colleges in Southern California: USC, Otis, Art Center College of Design and California Institute of the Arts. … see more

google_info: Pablo A. Medina - Founder - Design is Culture | LinkedIn
name: Pablo A. Medina
location: New York, New York, United States Contact info
about: Throughout my career, I've dedicated myself to three disciplines within design: design for commerce, design experimentation, and teaching. I taught for 14 years as an art and design professor, all the while mastering my design craft, working with clients such as the MoMA, The New York Times and ESPN. In 2016, I joined the country’s leading environmental organization, Natural Resources Defense Council as their Design Lead. These days, I'm either freelancing with some of the best agencies in New York City, including The Fader/Cornerstone, HUGE, Young & Rubicam and SY Partners, or working with clients at my studio Design is Culture in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. My typeface designs were exhibited at the prestigious Design Triennial exhibition at the Smithsonian’s Cooper Hewitt Museum and I am the recipient of the ADC Young Guns award. I have taught in both adjunct and full-time capacities at MICA, Parsons School of Design and California College of the Arts. … see more
